label: Description
value: A nude man is seated on a throne-like bench, facing left in profile. A woman, at his feet, grasps him about the waist, while one boy sits beside her. Another stands behind the man, holding a torch. A draped figure stands before him. Temple in background, right.

label: Provenance
value: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee; 1938: Acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund

label: Description
value: A: The Virgin stands in front of a high and large throne, the seat of which is covered with a cloth. She is seen from the front, carrying in her right arm the Child, and in her left lowered hand a book. B: The motif of the group is variated, in opposite direction. The Child puts his right arm around the neck of the Virgin. Below, at right, a helmet. The background is shaped like a niche, the upper part of which is like the sun with rays. Framing line.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and brown watercolor on paper

label: Provenance
value: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee; 1938: Acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund

label: Description
value: The Virgin stands turned toward right, in her arms the Child. A Paved floor and stairs, in the lower level, in the upper one what seems to be a donkey. View at a country side, the sky covered with clouds. Framing lines.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and brown watercolor on paper

label: Provenance
value: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee; 1938: Acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund

label: Description
value: The Virgin stands in front of what seems to be a sarcophagus in a niche. She is seen from the front, her head turned toward left, in profile. She supports with her left side the Child. In front, sitting on the floor, a man, seen from the back, holding with both hands a large book. Framing lines, except at left, the upper and the lower stretching at left as far as the edge.

label: Provenance
value: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee; 1938: Acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund

label: Description
value: The figure of Religion, bearing a cross, accompanied by small angel-like figures of children, rises from an open altar on which a chalice has been placed. Two figures stand, left. A nude woman reclines, right. Figures in background, right.

label: Provenance
value: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee; 1938: Acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund

label: Description
value: The Virgin is seated below, only the upper portion of her figure visible. The Child nude, except for a bit of draping over his right shoulder, stands between the encircling arms of the Virgin, center, holding a bird. Figures in background, left.

label: Provenance
value: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee; 1938: Acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund

label: Description
value: Above, in pencil, half-length group of the Virgin and Child, enclosed in frame. Before it, a shouting angel, in a cloud, flies toward right. A large winged angel, in ink, in foreground; city view, in pencil, in background, right.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, pen and ink, brush and bistre on paper

label: Provenance
value: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee; 1938: Acquired by the Museum

value: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
Designs for Bowl, Cup, and Saucer

label: Description
value: Designs for parts of a tea service, including a bowl, cup, and saucer. Probably made of cut glass, opal, and hyalite. Handle is shown at right. The decorations consist mainly of a row of gray ovoidal holes with gold beads inside, around the bodies. Golden handle and border lines.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gray, yellow, brown watercolor on cream paper

label: Provenance
value: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee, Brookline, MA; 1938: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
A Dream; Virgin on a Crescent

label: Description
value: Above, a sleeping figure, approached by a hooded draped figure of a woman, attended by a host of others, rising as they move along. Below - the full-length figure of the Virgin, standing on a crescent moon.

label: Provenance
value: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee; 1938: Acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund

label: Description
value: The same composition, with very little variations on either side of the sheet, in opposite directions. The saint drives the tempting woman, evidently Venus, into the sea; Cupid, sitting. At left, a turkey, and a large basket, hanging from a big tree. Framing lines.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, pen and ink, brush and grey-brown watercolor on paper

label: Description
value: The running figure of a nude putto, moving toward the left. He holds a kind of vessel above his head. Landscape briefly indicated.

Figures Mourning Over the Dead Christ

label: Description
value: Two half nude male figures bend over a dead man (possibly Christ). Three other figures in the background. Ink framing line.

value: Two seated lovers in a landscape with a dog and winged putti. Verso: Sketch of a proscnium curtain, a stage set of a columned court and scene showing a figure seated in a room.

value: Figure of a faun in uniform, carrying a large sword, which he holds forward with a mailed glove at his feet, faces a violently movemented figure who holds the tablets of the Divine Law before him. Other figures at right.

label: Description
value: A group of figures mourns over the dead Christ. In framing line. Verso: Two heads of satyrs, one seen in right profile, and the other frontally.

label: Description
value: A muse seated in a landscape with one hand resting on a bust of a warrior. Beside her, a genius presents a relief panel. In the right background, a classical temple. Ink framing line.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and bistre ink, brush and gray wash on paper

label: Description
value: The standing Virgin holds the Child on her left arm. Beside her stands a girl with a sun between the breasts; she lifts a wreath from he rhead. A palette, a bowl, and other indistrinct objects are on the floor. An enormous halo forms the background of the group. Framing lines.

label: Physical description
value: Pin and ink, brush and light brown watercolor on paper

label: Provenance
value: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee; 1938: Acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund

label: Description
value: Design for a candlestick. The triangular base is supported by three lion feet. The coat of arms of a prince Borghese is at the front. Cherubim are at the upper corners. The shaft of a baluster (foliated in its lower part) standing upon a reversed calyx, decorated with festoons in its upper parts. Above stand a bowl and a socket. The lower part of a candle is shown. Below is a breen base. Framing line below.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, pen and black ink, graphite on paper

value: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee, Brookline, MA; 1938: acquired by Museum

Sketch for a Painting: Abduction of a Child

label: Description
value: A figure with a small child flees in a classical landscape. At left, another figure crouches over a child. Two seraphs in the sky and a large setting sun. Ink framing line.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink on paper

value: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee; 1938: Acquired by the Museum

Scene in a Temple Dedicated to Athena

label: Description
value: At the center of the composition the statue of Athena is shown on a high pedestal, facing the spectator. Group of figures in foreground, right. Left: a warrior leans on his shield. View beyond the temple in distance, left. Three lines of inscription below.

value: In the foreground a nude child (Christ?) is seated, facing left in profile. A low wall is behind him, with a figure looking over it observing him. The base of a tall candelabrum is to the left of the child, behind him. Twenty-three lines of inscription, reverse.

Obverse and Revese: Sacred and Profane Love

label: Description
value: Left, the Virgin is seated beside the youthful Christ, who has His back turned toward the spectator. Right, a seated man embraces a nude woman, who attempts to repulse him. Verso: similar composition, with placement of figures reversed.

value: The saint is in full armor, he is shown on a rearing horse, facing right. He raises his spear to strike the dragon, left. Three lines of inscription, in ink, below framing line. Five lines of inscription, reverse.

Two Studies of Madonna and Child

label: Description
value: Left: Full-length figure of the Madonna, seated, facing the spectator. The Child stnads beside her, his left hand raised high, supporting a tablet which is on the Virgin's lap. Right: Full-length figure of the Madonna, seated, facing right, in profile. The Child stands before her, supporting a tablet.
